es.usc.citius.lab.joctomap.octree

Class JOctree

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.usc.citius.lab.joctomap.util.NativeObject
      • es.usc.citius.lab.joctomap.octree.JOctree

  • public class JOctree
extends NativeObject
    This class wraps an octree object in the Octomap library to be used in java; native wrapped functions include the following:
    • Translation between world coordinates and map keys.
    • Adjust a key to different depth levels.
    • Look for a node in the octree.
    • Query occupancy of a node.
    • Update occupancy of a node.
    • Manage limits and usage of the octree bounding box.
    • Query structure of the octree: size, depth, resolution.
    • Query size of a node.
    • Query center/limits of the octree: bounding box, space.
    • Query if the bounding box is set and applied.
    • Create iterators to traverse the leaf nodes of the octree.
    • Prune and expand nodes according to their occupancy.
    • Recalculate occupancy of inner nodes.
    • Save and load octree objects to disk.
    • Create empty octree.
    Author:
    adrian.gonzalez

        y - query point, coordinate Y
        z - query point, coordinate Z
        depth - level to search (depth=0 means search in the full octree)
        Returns:
        key of the node at the given position and depth

        Returns:

      • search

        public JOctreeNode search(JOctreeKey key,
                          int depth)
        Retrieves a node of the octree given the identifier of the node (JOctreeKey) and the depth to search in the JOctree.
        Parameters:
        key - identifier of the node
        depth - level to search (depth=0 means search in the full octree)
        Returns:
        node of the octree, if found, null otherwhise

      • search

        public JOctreeNode search(JOctreeKey key)
        Calls the method search(JOctreeKey, int) with the default value depth=0. Default values in argument methods are not supported by Java, so this method overload tries to emulate the call with the default value depth = 0;
        Parameters:
        key - identifier of the node
        Returns:
        node of the octree, if found, null otherwhise

      • search

        public JOctreeNode search(float x,
                          float y,
                          float z,
                          int depth)
        Retrieves a node of the JOctree in a given position of the 3D space and a depth level of the octree.
        Parameters:
        x - query point, coordinate X
        y - query point, coordinate Y
        z - query point, coordinate Z
        depth - level to search (depth=0 means search in the full octree)
        Returns:
        node of the octree, if found, null otherwhise

      • search

        public JOctreeNode search(float x,
                          float y,
                          float z)
        Calls the method search(float, float, float, int) with the default value of depth=0. Default values in argument methods are not supported by Java, so this method overload tries to emulate the call with the default value depth = 0;
        Parameters:
        x - query point, coordinate X
        y - query point, coordinate Y
        z - query point, coordinate Z
        Returns:
        node of the octree, if found, null otherwise

      • getMetricSize

        public float[] getMetricSize()
        Dimensions of the bounding box that contains the known space of the octree.
        Returns:
        a float[3] array with the dimensions x, y and z of the known space

      • isBBXSet

        public boolean isBBXSet()
        Queries if the bounding box is set. Returns true if getBBXMin() and getBBXMax() return the same value, as the BBX with the same beginning and ending point does not exist.
        Returns:
        true if getBBXMin() != getBBXMax()
        See Also:
        setBBX(Point3D, Point3D)

      • isBBXApplied

        public boolean isBBXApplied()
        Queries if the bounding box is being applied to the octree. When it is, the octree only applies updates for the region within the bounding box.
        Returns:
        true if a BBX being applied in the octree, false otherwise
        See Also:
        useBBXLimit(boolean)

        Parameters:

        i - child number
        Returns:

        Queries if this is a collapsible node.
        Parameters:
        node - instance of JOctreeNode to query
        Returns:
        true if all childs of the node exist, and they have not children of their own

      • leafBBXIterator

        public OctreeIterator leafBBXIterator(es.usc.citius.lab.motionplanner.core.spatial.Point3D min,
                                      es.usc.citius.lab.motionplanner.core.spatial.Point3D max,
                                      int maxDepth)
        Retrieve a bounding box iterator over the JOctreeKey of the leaf nodes of an octree. It is possible to define a maximum depth of the elements returned by the iterator.
        Parameters:
        min - min position of the bbx
        max - max position of the bbx
        maxDepth - max depth of the leaf nodes
        Returns:
        JOctreeKey iterator

      • leafBBXIterator

        public OctreeIterator leafBBXIterator(JOctreeKey min,
                                      JOctreeKey max,
                                      int maxDepth)
        Retrieve bounding box iterator over JOctreeKey of the leaf nodes of an octree. It is possible to define a maximum depth of the elements returned by the iterator.
        Parameters:
        min - min node key of the bbx
        max - max node key of the bbx
        maxDepth - max depth of the leaf nodes
        Returns:
        JOctreeKey iterator

      • prune

        public void prune()
        Prunes all the nodes in the octree (cuts all the children when they have the same value).

      • expand

        public void expand()
        Expands all the nodes in the octree to the minimum resolution.

      • updateInnerOccupancy

        public void updateInnerOccupancy()
        Updates the occupancy of inner nodes to reflect the children's occupancy; needed to correct the multi-resolution behavior when updated the occupancy with lazy evaluation enabled.

      • write

        public boolean write(String filename)
        Native implementation of the native function "write to file", that stores the information contained in the pointer of the direction of memory of the native OcTree object in the given path.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to store the file
        Returns:
        true if the file has correctly been stored

      • read

        public static JOctree read(String filename)
        Native implementation of the native function "read from file", that loads the information using the native implementation of Octomap and returns a new instance of JOctree.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of file to read
        Returns:
        pointer of the direction of memory of the loaded native OcTree object

      • create

        public static JOctree create(float res)
        Creates a new JOctree with a minimum resolution. An empty octree is not fully usable (you cannot query information about the bounds of the octree, or query the JOctreeKey corresponding to a posiition) until the first occupancy information is added using the modification methods like updateNode(float, float, float, boolean).
        Parameters:
        res - minimum node resolution
        Returns:
        octree with the given resolution

      • enableChangeDetection

        public void enableChangeDetection(boolean enable)
        Enables/disables changes detection. If enabled, a list of changes can be retrieved from this object when information in cells change over time.
        Parameters:
        enable - true for enable, false otherwise

      • resetChangeDetection

        public void resetChangeDetection()
        Clear the list of changes produced in the octree since the last reset.

      • keysChanged

        public List<JOctreeKey> keysChanged()
        Retrieves the list of changed keys since the last reset.
        Returns:
        list of JOctreeKey, cells changed since the last reset.

      • getTreeType

        public String getTreeType()
        Retrieves the tree type.
        Returns:
        C/C++ class name.
